result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon David Walsh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
At the Day Reporting Center. Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, treatment, and schooling. Court has no objection to Electronic Monitoring. Credit for 58 days time served.

 

Consecutive to: to any other sentence

MUST provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit with the balance due within one year after release from serving sentence. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
AODA assessment and treatment. Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
As a Convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon David Walsh

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 4 MONTHS at the Day Reporting Center / House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 58 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, treatment, and schooling. Court has no objection to Electronic Monitoring.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit with the balance due within one year after release from serving sentence. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample.
*  As a Convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Defendant Brandon David Walsh in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Brandon David Walsh in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
GPS violation received and filed.  No action taken at this time.

Attorney Lin contacted clerk and requested next court date be set for plea/sentencing.  Attorney Lin to contact state. Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing in Branch 26 on  04-04-2014 at 8:30 am.
Court ordered defendant's bail increased to $2500.00 Cash with turn over to JusticePoint.

BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 26
Defendant Brandon David Walsh in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State's request to increase defendant's bail for JusticePoint violation argued by counsel and granted by the court.
Violation Report received and filed with court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Brandon David Walsh in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-04-2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM004325  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
1/31/14 vf
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail set at $500 cash.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-07-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon David Walsh in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Brandon David Walsh in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for Nathaniel Adamson for the State of Wisconsin.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring with DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Brandon David Walsh in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Brandon David Walsh in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
